activities.loc: Br 9 - Law Enforcement Center - Lower Level

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.

9:00 AM Defendant Devon J Davidson in court.  Attorney Addison Kuhn for Erin J. Preston in court for Devon J Davidson.  Attorney Lucas P. Bennewitz in court for State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter:  Nancy Szeklinski. 
Defense requests 1 final status, cases should resolve.
Status conference scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Atty. Erin Preston.

9:49 AM Defendant Devon J Davidson in court.  Attorney Lucas P. Bennewitz in court for State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter:  Nancy Szeklinski. 
Matter here for bond hearing in 22CF601.  
Defendant has bonded out at this time.  Defendant does not have counsel.  Will go to SPD office to reapply.
Status conference scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on September 30, 2022 at 09:00 am.

9:21 AM Prosecuting attorney Dirk Christian Jensen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Devon J Davidson in court, in custody. Court Reporter:  Nancy Szeklinski. 
Defendant moves to modify bond to $500 cash bond.  Bond has been posted in 18CF53 & 18CF403.  Defendant is requesting to reduce bail in 22CF601 to $500 cash bond.  Defendant states he has been incarcerated for over 2 years.
State obj.
Defendant states he would be under 24 hours supervision by DOC with GPS.  He will be on supervision August 11, 2022 with State of Illinois DOC.
Defendant to talk to Agent, have Agent send a letter to the Court with the plan of defendant's supervision and will consider modifying bond after this has been received.
Defendant has plan and provides to the Court for review.
Court reviews plan from Agent.
BTC: Bond will not be modified to $500, will consider a minimum amount of $2500 cash, defendant to have family member present for bond hearing.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Bail/bond hearing on August 19, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Bail/bond hearing on August 2, 2022 at 09:15 am.

9:47 AM Prosecuting attorney Lucas P. Bennewitz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Devon J Davidson in court, in custody. Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue. 
Defendant is attempting to obtain his funds in his institutions account but has been unable to access funds.
BTC: Set cases for bond motion.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 09:15 am.
for reduction of bail amount
Status conference on July 25, 2022 at 09:00 am.

11:38 AM Prosecuting attorney Lucas P. Bennewitz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Devon J Davidson in court, in custody.  Attorney Erin J. Preston in court for Devon J Davidson. Court Reporter:  Nancy Szeklinski. 
Defendant is requesting for Atty. Preston to withdraw.
Defendant is currently looking to retain counsel and if cannot will try this case pro se.  Defendant wishes to have cases set out some time to be able to attempt to retain counsel.
Defendant understands that the jury trial will be rescheduled.
BTC: Motion by defendant granted, Atty. Preston allowed to withdraw.  Finding of good cause to waive time limits on prompt disposition.
Status conference scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Hearing on May 24, 2022 at 11:30 am.

11:27 AM Prosecuting attorney Lucas P. Bennewitz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Devon J Davidson in court, in custody.  Attorney Erin J. Preston in court for Devon J Davidson. Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue. 
Parties are in trial posture.
BTC: 18CF53 #1, 18CF403 #2, other case to track.
Deft. to plea in 18CF53, plea to 3 ID counts, dri balance.  18CF403 to be dri.  State requesting PSI and following recommendation.  22CF6012 is not contemplated in the offer.
Court holds colloquy with defendant regarding State's offer.
Deft. states he was told something different.  Request to have new counsel appointed and have Atty. Preston withdraw from his cases. State he will represent himself and move forward pro se.
BTC: Set for hearing on defendant's motion to move forward pro se.
Hearing scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 11:30 am.

records.addlTxt: atty Preston

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
